fields.description: Need to be able to manage Access Keys, Branch Permissions, WebHook Settings, Default Reviewers (essentially all Repo Settings) across 100s of Repos within our Project. Would be helpful if there was an API that would return the settings and allow us to post updates for specific repos, or global updates to all repos.
fields.summary: Need ability to manage Repo settings via Webhook or API

fields.description: The  Help & Feedback button at the Pipeline's page shows the option to "Get Help from the Community". When that link is clicked, page is being redirected to a 404 Page as shown in the screenshot attached.
fields.summary: "Get help from the community" in Pipelines redirecting to 404 Page

fields.description:
We want to compose multiple services using Docker, configured via environment variables and talk to each via links.

Here is an (anonymized) example of our _docker-compose_ file:

{code}
#!yml

# Run using scripts in ../bin/ to set env vars correctly

version: '2'
services:
  service-a:
    container_name: ${SERVICE_ID}
    image: ${DOCKER_IMAGE}
    ports:
      - ${PORT}:${PORT}
    environment:
      - DYNAMO_AWS_REGION=ap-southeast-2
      - DYNAMO_ENDPOINT=http://dynamo:8006
      - DYNAMO_TABLE_NAME=table
      - SQS_LOCAL_PORT=9324
      - SPRING_PROFILES_ACTIVE=local,docker

    depends_on:
      - service-b
      - db2
      - elasticmq-sqs
    links:
      - db2:dynamo
      - elasticmq-sqs:sqs

  db2:
    container_name: ${SERVICE_ID}-dynamo
    image: tray/dynamodb-local
    ports:
      - 8006:8006
    command: -inMemory -port 8006 -sharedDb

  service-b:
    container_name: service-b
    image: someImage:1.0.0-SNAPSHOT
    environment:
      - DYNAMO_AWS_REGION=ap-southeast-2
      - DYNAMO_AWS_ENDPOINT=http://dynamodb:8005
      - DYNAMO_TABLE_NAME=table
    ports:
      - 8085:8085
    depends_on:
      - db1
    links:
      - db1:dynamodb

  db1:
    container_name: db1
    image: tray/dynamodb-local
    ports:
      - 8005:8005
    command: -inMemory -port 8005 -sharedDb

  elasticmq-sqs:
    image: tddmonkey/elasticmq
    ports:
      - 9324:9324

{code}
fields.summary: Defer build until service containers are running like docker compose

fields.description: In some scenarios, when a repository is transferred to another account (or team) there is a notice, but there is no way to confirm the transfer (only 'revoke')
fields.summary: Missing transfer repository e-mail / notification

fields.description:
Here's my reproduction of the bug:

# start by adding some team members
# then I create a branch permission with said team members
# then I remove a user (from the team)
# then I edit previously made branch permission (notice nothing is there)
# then I try to add back the rest of the team but the drop down is only completing my name
fields.summary: Branch permission is empty when removing a team member (and rest of the team is gone from the drop down)

fields.description:
We understand that the fork workflow can be used to create forked repositories under the team account, however, this makes the team overview/repository list very crowded.

We would like to list the forked repository in a separated list or/and by projects.

eg.

* The user "Aby" create a fork named "fork_from_A"
* She can grant access for every user that belongs to the team.
* This repository is "owned" by the "Team_A" _OR_ "Project_A" and it's not listed in the team overview, anyway, it's accessible by the TeamA.

This would provide the user that use the forked workflow, a cleaner view of the team account and a better access control since the repositories would be managed by project and/or would not be listed in the "Main Repository" (overview) of the team.
fields.summary: Improve the fork workflow for teams

fields.description: When using close-source-branch option on a PR merge for a cross-fork Hg PR, the source branch is only closed on the source repo.
fields.summary: Mercurial cross-fork pullrequests don't close branch on both src and dest repos

fields.description:
When you enter to the profile of a team, if all the projects are marked as private, the first time it doesn't show you anything, but if you change the tab again to projects it will show you all the team projects even if they are marked as private.

Tested using incognito mode:

[step1 enter to the url projects|http://prntscr.com/euqzta]

[enter another tab|http://prntscr.com/eur0id]

[go back to the projects tab|http://prntscr.com/eur0tt]
fields.summary: Bug on Team Profile Project Privacy Broken

fields.description:
I want to install Python in an Ubuntu image because I need Rsync, since it isn't possible for a pipeline to write output files to a certain repository (Correct me if I am wrong). But I can't seem to run any commands with my ubuntu image.

I am using:

{code}
#!yml

# This is a sample build configuration for Python.
# Check our guides at https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/x4UWN for more examples.
# Only use spaces to indent your .yml configuration.
# -----
# You can specify a custom docker image from Docker Hub as your build environment.
image: ubuntu:16.04

pipelines:
  tags:                         # add the 'tags' section
    RobotTest-**:                   # specify the tag
      - step:                   # define the build pipeline for the tag
          script: # Modify the commands below to build your repository.
            - RUN apt-get update 
                 && apt-get install -y sudo 
                 && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* 
            - RUN add-apt-repository ppa:fkrull/deadsnakes 
            - RUN apt-get install python2.7.9 
            - RUN pip install robotframework-selenium2library requests
            - RUN PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:. pybot -d RobotFramework/Results --variable BROWSER:chrome --variable VERSION:latest --variable PLATFORM:MAC RobotFramework/Tests/ExpressionEngine.robot

{code}

But it says "Command not found" no matter what I do\\
So I have tried:\\
RUN\\
Sudo\\
no prefix

But nothing works.

Anyone knows the solution?
fields.summary: Install Python in Ubuntu for RobotFramework

fields.description:
Looking at the warning message we shrinked our repo *(bitbucket.org/anusaaraka/anusaaraka.git)* on 11-03-2017\\
After shrinking, the size is as follows\\
git count-objects -vH\\
count: 0\\
size: 0 bytes\\
in-pack: 25575\\
packs: 1\\
size-pack: *194.13 MiB*\\
prune-packable: 0\\
garbage: 0\\
size-garbage: 0 bytes

And our folder size is : du -hs anusaaraka == 607MB

We have emailed support@bitbucket.org on *Mar 13 2017* But still we get the "This repository's size is over 1 GB." message.\\
Kindly fix this issue.
fields.summary: Request for repo size

fields.description: When I clone a repository from bitbucket, it puts the top-level repository directory in all lower case.  This is incorrect behavior.  It also breaks any file-based references on Linux.
fields.summary: Bitbucket changes case with cloning repository

fields.description:
bq. Hi there,\\
It would be very nice to have Elm added to the list of languages in the drop-down list when creating a new repo.


From https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-9684
fields.summary: Add Elm as an option when creating repository

fields.description:
I just forked another project that has an identical deployment plan (e.g. bitbucket-pipelines.yml) is already there.

Yet pipelines  wants me to select a template.  This seems counter-intuitive.
fields.summary: Please allow pipelines to see if the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file is present on new repos

fields.description:
When tagging a commit online, a webhook is sent but it does not contain the tag as a change. This breaks our external ci integration, as it doesn't know what changed and can't act accordingly.

See this log of the webhook sent when creating a tag:\\
!https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/uploads-eu.hipchat.com/62625/433013/BKw9ZOsCpJ6jeMF/upload.png!
fields.summary: Webhooks don't contain tags created online

fields.description: It would be great if there was some way to only notify Slack to send a notification if a failed build in pipeline Happens. Don't want to notify if it was successful, just failed. I know I get the email notifications, but to able to have it in Slack would be great.
fields.summary: Pipeline Fail Notification for Slack
Turkish/Special character displayed wrongly in Pipelines

Currently, issues can be viewed by Assigned tickets, Reported, Participating, Watching, Teams.

Need a feature in Bitbucket Cloud to view issues which is filtered by user.

fields.summary: Option to disable the JIRA issue details modal

fields.description: In Bitbucket password reset, an overlay text mentions to use either username or email to do the password reset. Username no longer works, so it should be removed.

This link redirects back to the main page which is "https://support.atlassian.com/contact/".

This link would need to be updated.

It would be great if we could get the ! operator included for globs, as described in the Wikipedia article: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glob_(programming)

I am looking to trigger builds on, for example, 'v3.50.1' but not on 'v3.50.1s'
fields.summary: Add support for ! operator in globs

fields.description: But i've done it, if you create your first repo without project you can create one from the repo screen. The key isn't checked here.!3872426409-Screenshot%20from%202017-04-06%2010-50-15.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Key cannot start with number

fields.description: When user performs merge in Pull Request, the email notification show's the wrong user performed the merge.
fields.summary: Pull request  email notification shows wrong user details when merged

fields.description:
Our projects consists of couple of mini projects.\\
Currently on each push we execute all the tests & deploy all the mini projects to app engine.\\
This creates lots of different versions and takes a lot of time.

If we could configure that different scripts run for file changes in specific directories it would save us lots of build minutes and will create only the relevant deployments. (Maybe even by commit text, if contains some word).

Also, because PIpelines runs only for the last commit of each push, it should know to check all the changes in the latest push, and not only the latest commit.
fields.summary: Execute script based on changed files/folders

fields.description:
When selecting "View File" from the commits, it will redirect to the source file however, the option was disabled due to the following message below.

!2340534840-Screen%20Shot%202017-04-06%20at%202.51.03%20PM.png|thumbnail!

!938586571-Screen%20Shot%202017-04-06%20at%202.49.08%20PM.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*:\\
Manually view the file by reselecting the branch and commits SHA on the current source page.
fields.summary: Selecting "View File" to view source under commits page cannot be edited

fields.description:
Could we add support for building pull requests?

Essentially when a PR comes is or updated, we would test the merge between the origin and the upstream branch.

This would be similar to what Travis does: https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/pull-requests/
fields.summary: Building pull requests

fields.description:
Right now, if you use the "Require a minimum of n successful build(s)" if any build fails then you can't merge without a new commit. This doesn't work for us as we have a system test as part of the build process and if another component (in a different repository) is failing this causes the build to fail. If that other component is fixed and the build is rerun in the repo that didn't actually have anything wrong with it the build succeeds. But if we set the "Require a minimum of n successful build(s)" we still can't merge.

Simply adding an option where I can set the "Require the last build to succeed" fixes this problem.

Without this I can't control blocking a merge on a repo that is currently failing. Not a good part of my CI/CD.
fields.summary: Let "Require a minimum of N successful build(s)" ignore failing builds

fields.description:
When creating multi-line code snippets in markdown it is not being rendered correctly.  We have found that the code is being rendered as a single line code snippet. Please see screenshots for examples:

*Multi-line code snippets  from our README.md file*

* !1901077865-Screenshot_040517_100106_AM.jpg|thumbnail!
* !4258394052-Screenshot_040517_100730_AM.jpg|thumbnail!

*Multi-line code snippets as rendered*

* !3597774934-Screenshot_040517_100223_AM.jpg|thumbnail!
* !321492132-Screenshot_040517_100605_AM.jpg|thumbnail!

We are also seeing that ordered lists that were rendering correctly are not rendering correctly anymore. See examples below:

*Ordered list from our code*\\
!810512959-Screenshot_040517_101023_AM.jpg|thumbnail!

*Ordered list as rendered*\\
!690765390-Screenshot_040517_100848_AM.jpg|thumbnail!

We noticed these issues around mid-week last week and have been worried about wasting time opening and working tickets to update the markdown files if it seems to be a Bitbucket issue.
fields.summary: Markdown is not rendering correctly

fields.description:
It seems, that all users who are watching a certain Bitbucket Repo will be notified if a pipeline build failed.

It would be great, if users had the option to choose only to be notified bit pipelines, if they have been one of the authors of any change 'between' the last stable bitbucket build and the failing build.
fields.summary: Notification about failure only to authors of changes

fields.description:
Session time problem.\\
For example.\\
I come to the office at 11am. Then work in Bitbucket till 2pm.\\
Next day I come to the office in 12pm then get meeting and open Bitbucket just at 3pm.\\
What I see? I've been logged out.\\
As a user I use it every day, but for the system I try to use session in 25 hours from the last touch.\\
I propose you to change this very user unfriendly behavior make session time longer up to 48 hours.
fields.summary: Make session time to 48h

fields.description: It would be great if we could use this environment variable in custom builds. I was imagining it would be populated when the version is tagged, and empty when there is no tag referencing a commit.
fields.summary: Support for $BITBUCKET_TAG in custom builds on Mercurial

fields.description:
Giving a star to a project is a great way to motivate the developer and show your respect. Stars are also a great measure of project popularity.

I'd love to see a similar system on Bitbucket. No necessarily starts, maybe buckets would suit better.

The ability to star things is GitHub's huge competitive advantage.
fields.summary: Add something like GitHub stars

fields.description: [Nim|https://nim-lang.org] is not called Nimrod for quite some time already. Please rename the language in the Bitbucket interface.
fields.summary: Rename Nimrod to Nim

fields.description:
https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/apn/announcing-atlassian-bitbucket-support-for-aws-codedeploy/

As per the above link, I can able to deploy from multiple branches to multiple servers. But everytime I need to go to codedeploy settings & need to adjust settings.

*Need to implement like under code deploy settings user can able to add "N" number of AWS Deploy Applications*

Assume: There are 2 Applications in aws code deploy say 1. cicd_prod_app, 2. cicd_preprod_app.

So in bitbucket under settings It has show Application name, S3 bucket name, Branch with addmore option. So user can add his another application, another s3bucket and another branch. Like wise can able to add N number of applications along with S3buckets & branch name.

In bitbucket Im using multiple branches like production, preproduction, testing, staging etc..\\
So when code is pushed to preproduction branch the application cicd_preprod_app need to be trigger & deploy the code to my preprod server. similarly to production.

or

After merging code to any branch, When user manually click on *Deploy to AWS* link, It has to show a radio button with list of applications which we configured under settings.\\
so the user will select his appropriate application & Deployment Group and will click on submit

Thanks & Regards,\\
Sandeep Vanam
fields.summary: Using "AWS CodeDeploy for Bitbucket" addon users can not able to add N number of AWS Deploy applications
Atlassian Bitbucket Status feed hacked?

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

Create a new repo in Bitbucket, and goto the Pipelines page.

*Expected behaviour:*

I would be able to setup pipelines and have a {{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}} file created. I would be able to have a simple {{echo 1}} command and verify that Pipelines runs correctly. I can then start to flesh out my repo and have CI in play from the very start.

*Actual behaviour:*

!3876969102-upload.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Can't setup pipelines on an empty repo

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

Browse to the Pull request page for a repo, and ⌘+click on a build status icon.

*Expected behaviour:*

The link is opened in a new tab.

*Actual behaviour:*

The link is opened in the *same* tab.
fields.summary: ⌘ + click on the build status icon on the Pull request page does not open in a new tab

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

Hovering the build status icon on the pull request page.

*Expected behaviour:*

It does not say 'undefined of 1 failed'.

!475683498-Screen%20Shot%202017-04-04%20at%204.04.17%20pm.png|thumbnail!

*Actual behaviour:*

It says 'undefined of 1 failed'.
fields.summary: Incorrect tooltip for build status on Pull request page

fields.description:
Recently, my team has been getting prompted to log in almost every day, even when browser and IP are not changing. This is quite annoying, especially when we use MFA.

I use BitBucket consistently from 3 different computers, but even just being able to use it from 1 without being nagged would be good.
fields.summary: Getting logged out frequently

fields.description:
Bitbucket Cloud is incorrectly displaying a 500 error instead of a more descriptive error set.

h2. *Workaround:*
Reset your password at https://bitbucket.org/account/password/reset/, and try configuring 2FA again with your new password.
fields.summary: Users are getting a 500 error when they enter their password wrong too many times on the two-step setup page. (BBCDEV-6322)

fields.description:
At present the only way to specify a pipeline is to have a "bitbucket-pipelines.yml".

This causes a proliferation of files across all the projects. Nearly all the projects have similar pipelines with just the target name being changed. If we have to add a step or modify a step then we have to edit a lot of projects.

e.g.:

{code}
        - aws s3 mv serviceframework*.jar s3://<folder>/<app name>-test-$BUILD_VERSION-$BUILD_TIME.jar --metadata version="$BUILD_VERSION",time="$BUILD_TIME"
{code}

The app name and folder can also come as environment variables in the project.

What is needed is the ability to upload pipeline.yml files into the global settings for pipelines.\\
Then you should allow us to link the file to the project in the pipeline settings for the project. There will not be a bitbucket-pipelines.yml in the base folder of the project. It will only be a configuration setting in the bitbucket ui.

This is a very essential feature in order to avoid script file proliferation.
fields.summary: Sharing pipeline yml files

fields.description:
Atm about 50% of my pushes and pulls take a unusual amount of time to initiate the SSH connection.

When i use ssh -v -v -v git@bitbucket.org I can see that sometimes it takes very long for the SSH server to answer. I can reproduce this from two different networks from the netherlands.

{code}
ssh -v -v -v git@bitbucket.org
OpenSSH_7.3p1, LibreSSL 2.4.1
debug1: Reading configuration data .ssh/config
debug1: /Users/djhartman/.ssh/config line 40: Applying options for *
debug1: Reading configuration data /etc/ssh/ssh_config
debug1: /etc/ssh/ssh_config line 20: Applying options for *
debug2: resolving "bitbucket.org" port 22
debug2: ssh_connect_direct: needpriv 0
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org [104.192.143.2] port 22.
debug1: Connection established.
debug1: identity file .ssh/id_rsa type 1
debug1: key_load_public: No such file or directory
debug1: identity file .ssh/id_rsa-cert type -1
debug1: Enabling compatibility mode for protocol 2.0
debug1: Local version string SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_7.3
{code}

There is a 3 to 10 second waiting period here, where it seems it is waiting for the ssh server to respond.

{code}
debug1: Remote protocol version 2.0, remote software version conker_1.0.288-e9ef8ea app-123
debug1: no match: conker_1.0.288-e9ef8ea app-123
debug2: fd 5 setting O_NONBLOCK
debug1: Authenticating to bitbucket.org:22 as 'git'
[etc]
{code}
fields.summary: git push and pull over SSH takes long to initiate

fields.description:
Hello,

In my build, after building and testing, I deploy my application with a curl command to rundeck.\\
I want check when the application is done deploying with a command like :

{code}
#!bash

while ! curl --output /dev/null --silent --head --fail http://url/healthcheck; do echo "wait..."; sleep 2; done
{code}

But the command loop infinitely, the curl doesn't seem to work.\\
But it work when I run it in the docker container maven:3.3.3 on my computer.

Do you have any idea why it doesn't work?

Thank you very much in advance.

Adrien
fields.summary: while curl is not working great on pipeline

fields.description:
I accidentally deleted a deployment key today. Bitbucket does not ask for confirmation before deleting.\\
It would be nice to have this feature.
fields.summary: Ask for confirmation before deleting a deployment key
Cannot invite people to a repository if your name, or the repo name contains non-ascii characters

fields.description: In the dropdown menu of the "Repositories" button of the navigation bar, the option to "create repository" appears almost at the end of the list (just above "Import repository"). When you have viewed a lot of repositories the item is not easily reached from the menu having to scroll down the screen. It's silly, but I think that both import and create options should be accesible as the first two items of the dropdown menu.
fields.summary: "Create repository" button appears far down the dropdown list

Please refer the screenshot

!146275952-bitbucketBug.JPG|thumbnail!

fields.description:
It would be really nice if rst file viewer detected changelogs and presented issue numbers and commit hashes as links to respective issues/commits.

Example: https://bitbucket.org/plas/thonny/src/master/CHANGELOG.rst
fields.summary: Automatically link to issues and commits from changelog files
REST API: Wiki page update by PUT not working

fields.description:
With recent update which added [modal detail for JIRA issues|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/bitbucket/stay-in-context-with-jira-issue-details-in-bitbucket-cloud] disappeared possibility to open issue in a new window easily. As JIRA issue key isn't regular link anymore, I'm not able to open JIRA issue directly with _middle click_ or _Open link in new tab_ context menu without loading modal dialog.

My primary concern is about links in the list of commits but would be good to have keys as links everywhere.
fields.summary: JIRA issue key isn't clickable link

fields.description:
If I rebase my branch and push changes to server in Activity screen for that pull request I get little bit confusing message about {{UPDATES}}.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create branch from master
# Made some changes and push it to PR_branch
# Create Pull Request to merge that changes
# Do some changes in master
# Rebase your PR_branch and push changes to server
# Check Activity tab for that pull request and observe that there is message: "<user> {{UPDATED}} by adding x commits y seconds ago"

It's possible mark that activity not as {{UPDATED}} but as {{REBASED}}?
fields.summary: Mark rebase activity not as 'Updated' but as 'Rebased'

fields.description:
Git is treating FORM_FEED as a standard whitespace character and not counting it as a newline, but somewhere in our Side-by-side code we treat it as a newline, then the side-by-side diff we end up showing is all kinds of wrong because the line numbers are all off.

A line of the file that contains U+000C is correctly counted as one line in the “View file” view, but incorrectly counts as two lines in the “Side-by-side diff” view.

Characters such as U+0009, U+000C, U+0020, U+2009, etc. are all valid white space in Unicode text files, and should not cause inconsistent line counts. Only U+000A LINE FEED should cause the line count to increase.
fields.summary: ASCII whitespace characters can cause the side-by-side diff to show line numbers incorrectly

fields.description:
In your help at https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/set-up-ssh-for-git-728138079.html (Bitbucket-cloud, Setup SSH for Git), you suggest that if ssh-agent is not running one should start it with: "ssh-agent /bin/bash", and "ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_rsa". This starts a new shell which is somewhat unsatisfactory. A better way to start it is with:

eval $(ssh-agent) > /dev/null\\
ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_rsa

These lines modify the current shell instead of starting a new shell, and after this one can use git clone/push/pull happily and passwordlessly http://blog.joncairns.com/2013/12/understanding-ssh-agent-and-ssh-add/
fields.summary: Alteration of commands on documentation.

fields.description:
It would be very helpful to set default files for new repos for a team in Bitbucket Cloud.  Especially .gitignore and readme files.  The files would have content that makes sense for a specific team - so it wouldn't be a global default for the entire Bitbucket cloud site.  For instance, I'd love to have my gitignore file that contains all sorts of Visual Studio, PHPStorm and other files that our team does not like to commit.

I would imagine this feature to live in the team settings area.
fields.summary: Default files (gitignore) for new repos

fields.description:
This is a super minor thing that would be kind of nice to use and shouldnt really introduce any new complexity.

Currently, when on a pipeline I can see breadcrumbs links for

Username / Repo / Pipelines

Each of those link where you would expect. What I'd like is an extra link that links to the Pipelines page for the particular branch that the pipeline is running from.

Username / Repo / Pipelines / Branch

So, Pipelines would link to\\
https://bitbucket.org/<username>/<repo>/addon/pipelines/home#!/\\
and Branch would link to\\
https://bitbucket.org/<username>/<repo>/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/branch/<branch>/page/1

I'm hoping this should be a pretty trivial change and would be more than willing to make a PR if you would like.

Cheers!
fields.summary: Navigate from pipeline back to pipelines page with branch filtered
Authenticating using Git Credential Manager throws the error "remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party..."

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to see the diffs of LFS tracked text files in pull requests and so on. I have some large text files, mainly resource files for Unity, which I track in LFS to keep the repo size down. I lose the ability to review changes to these files though in pull requests.
fields.summary: Git LFS diff of text files

fields.description: It would be nice if we could have the option of list in list on Bitbucket Cloud as we have on Bitbucket server. See: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/markdown-syntax-guide-776639995.html#Markdownsyntaxguide-Listinlist
fields.summary: Markdown on wiki page doesn’t offer list in list option

fields.description:
here is the use case:

# Customer currently logged in Chrome with both work and personal accounts - 2 separate email addresses though
# Has a bitbucket account for both of these emails
# Logged in with Google I realized I was with the wrong Bitbucket account  at the moment.
# jumps back in my browser history and Single Sign On presented me with choosing which Account I would like to log in with, they choose the second account  BitBucket reacted with a bit of a wait and presents an error code to the user that really doesn't explain to them what went wrong.

Can we please update that error message to say something like "this is not supported please refresh the session and start over"
fields.summary: Provide a better message to customers when logging in to multiple Google Accounts on one Browser session

fields.description:
For (big) refactorings it is often a good indicator to compare the size of the code before and after, in most of the cases the code should be reduced by using the patterns DRY, KISS and especially YAGNI.

For reviews it would be great if it is possible to see the sum of inserted and removed lines, like _git diff --stat_.
fields.summary: Summarize insertions/deletions in "Files changed (...)" component

fields.description:
As a BitBucket user, I would love the option to be able to use my repositories as node packages.

Currently, using GIT-based linking, NPM only supports one root-level {{package.json}} file. This is great, unless your repository hosts a number of dynamically generated node packages (such as [Ionic Native|https://github.com/driftyco/ionic-native]).

This seems to be the trend with JavaScript libraries -- entire libraries are being sliced into modular NPM packages in order to reduce the amount of unused code a client needs.

Currently, [NPM|https://npmjs.org] offers a paid service for private node module hosting but as a user within an enterprise, additional service buy-in is a tough sell.
fields.summary: Private NPM Repositories
Can't set tab-size above 4 (e.g. `?ts=8`)

fields.description:
When diffs timeout they show the "Oops! You've got a lot of code" warning.

However if the diff includes renames then the files that should be showing the warning display nothing and all files after that file display wrong.

You can see the problem here:\\
https://bitbucket.org/sgoodhew/large-file-testing/commits/fb3472e

And a slightly different diff (same changes but no renames) that displays correctly here:\\
https://bitbucket.org/sgoodhew/large-file-testing/commits/433d500
fields.summary: Diffs with renames and files that timeout loading don't fully display

fields.description:
If you select the "Close source branch" option when merging but you don't have write access to the source repository the PR will not merge correctly.

h3. Git:
The code is merged and new commits end up on the destination branch, but the branch isn't closed in the source repo, and the PR is left in the "Open" state even though there are now no longer any changes.

The UI spins forever not acknowledging that the PR has been merged.

h3. Hg:
The UI spins forever and no changes are made to the source or destination repositories.
fields.summary: You cannot close the branch of a cross-fork PR if you don't have write access to the source.

fields.description:

The problem only occurs when your current Bitbucket name has unicode characters in it. Adding existing Bitbucket username does not reproduce this issue. Sample error message on the developers console below:

{code}
#!error

{type: "error",…}
error

{message: "'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\u0103' in position 1: ordinal not in range(128)",…}
id

"06d95679b9554aadb5dcc5df4a9de6fc"
message
:
"'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\u0103' in position 1: ordinal not in range(128)"
type
:
"error"
Name

{code}
fields.summary: Could not invite email error when current username contains unicode character

fields.description:
Pull Request Description Template:

We have sizeable team of developers working on the project:

* absolutely do not want each of them provide change list details in their own format

* code reviews are getting increasingly difficult in the absence of this standardization

fields.description:
When moving from github which happily accepts checkboxes with {{- [x]}} (in their checked state) and {{- [ ]}} in their unchecked state allowing the user to lazily click on them when an bug or part of an issue opened is fixed. However on bitbucket those are not supported and are processed to:

* [ ] example that should become an checkbox for this test here but is not.

Otherwise the markdown on bitbucket is about to par with github's except for the checkboxes and stuff.
fields.summary: Add support for checkboxes made in markdown.

fields.description:
Feedback from customer:

_I’ve got a lot of npm modules under my command, all with varying npm dependencies – I’ve got a docker image with any npm global installs that are shared by all, but other than it’s not worth pinning down shared deps for the modules themselves. On a normal build server (and locally in dev), after the initial npm install, when dependencies change subsequent npm installs are very short. So, if I were setting it up myself from scratch in docker, I’d probably experiment with a docker commit at the end of a build, then keeping the images round for a week or so to speed up subsequent builds_
fields.summary: Allow Docker container snapshots in Pipelines

fields.description:
When sending to someone the link to the _Create issue_ page you can currently pass in a suggested title and content

E.g. [https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/new?title=foo&content=bar|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/new%3Ftitle%3Dfoo%26content%3Dbar]

I would find really useful to be able to pass in also the issue's *Kind* and *Priority*.

This way I could provide my clients/testers two different links to submit bugs and proposals.
fields.summary: Create issue link to accept kind and priority parameters

fields.description:
When customer is adding branch restrictions prevent them from adding too many to avoid page time out when accessing the Branch permissions page for modification.\\

Customer by accident added over 1800 restrictions so the Branch permissions page wasn't accessible for him anymore.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Go to /downloads/ section of your repo.
# Switch between Downloads, Tags and Branches tabs there.
# Use back and forward navigation, either GUI buttons of a browser or Alt+respective arrow key.

Expected behaviour:\\
Tab's content switches, selected tab's indicator switches accordingly.

Actual behaviour:\\
Tab's content switches properly, but the active tab label does not. As a result, content doesn't match the tab.

Attached, a screenshot where the Tabs tab actually has the content from Branches tab.\\
While admittedly this doesn't seem critical, it can potentially lead to confusion. if tags and branches have the same names, one can download a wrong archive.

!2586661629-Error%20Download.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: On repo's downloads section, the tab switcher works incorrectly if Back or Forward keys are used
Invalid branch name

fields.description: My older repos have a service link in the settings to allow us to set up Pivotal Tracker with a Token and everything comes to life for our automation. However, there is a disconnect as to how this can be achieved using webhooks. All of the details are hidden in a service that we don't know how to replicate in a web hook for newer repos that no longer have the services link in the settings. What is the solution for us to be able to bridge the gap for Pivotal Tracker between the deprecated services and the new webhooks so that all of us can continue to use our automation with Pivotal Tracker with newer repos, please?
fields.summary: Disconnect between deprecated Services and new Webhook leaving some of us high and dry
pull request merging erroring out

fields.description: In Pipelines - are there plans to allow JUnit XML test reports to be rendered like Jenkins or should this be done in another way?
fields.summary: Reporting on Tests

fields.description:
I want to be able to add a recovery phone number to my account, so if I have enabled the two factor authentication, lost my phone and my local ssh repository, I would be able to restore it through an SMS to the recovery phone I add to my account.

I give it a critical issue, because for me it was a big issue!

I just left my old work and my local ssh repository deleted and my phone as well, good that I had an ssh repository at home so i could get the recovery codes.\\
If I did not had two ssh repositories so I would have lost my data!!!
fields.summary: As a user I would like to have the ability to get a verification code through SMS

fields.description:
I love the addition of custom pipelines but it is still several extra steps to push my commit, open up bitbucket, load the commit, and trigger the custom pipeline manually.

In the same way that I can use {{[ci skip]}} in a commit message to skip the default pipeline build, I would like to be able to use commit messages to trigger custom builds.  E.g.

{{[ci custom]}} would trigger a custom build named "custom"\\
{{[ci my-awesome-build]}} would trigger a custom build named "my-awesome-build"
fields.summary: Trigger custom pipeline build with git comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Adding a colon in a string in Pipelines .yml file breaks the build

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a bitbucket-pipelines.yml with the following content:

{code}
#!python

pipelines:
  default:
  - step:
      script:
        - echo "Test: Colon"
{code}

# Push to trigger a build

h3. Expected Results
The build runs successfully

h3. Actual Results
The build fails with the following error: !890762183-Screen%20Shot%202017-03-22%20at%2017.14.09.png|thumbnail!

It looks that the colon in the string might be interpreted as a yaml separator?

h3. Notes
For some reason, including the echo command in the string works:

{code}
#!python

pipelines:
  default:
  - step:
      script:
        - "echo Test: Colon"
{code}
fields.summary: Adding a colon in a string in Pipelines .yml file breaks the build

fields.description:
Hello,

I cannot explain this :

!2070528951-unknownPath.png|thumbnail!

As you can see, Bitbucket didn't find my file (but it still exist in my repo) but link to :

https://bitbucket.org/WhatEverUser/WhatEverRepo/src/null/bitbucket-pipelines.yml
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipelines - /src/null/bitbucket-pipelines.yml
Atlassian Editor auto escapes copy pasted special characters even in code blocks - (ED-1158)
